tool.name: KEGG pathway mapping (pathview)

param.name: ids
param.label: Provide your identifiers
param.help: Copy/paste or ID list from a file (e.g. table)

param.name: txt
param.label: Copy/paste your identifiers
param.help: IDs must be separated by "," into the form field, for example: P31946,P62258

param.name: file
param.label: Select a file that contains your list of IDs

param.name: header
param.label: Does your input file contain header?

param.name: ncol
param.label: The column number of IDs to map
param.help: For example, fill in "c1" if it is the first column, "c2" if it is the second column and so on

param.name: pathways_id
param.label: Provide your pathway(s)
param.help: Enter KEGG pathway name(s) or KEGG pathway id(s)

param.name: pnames
param.label: Select pathway(s)
param.help: You can select one or several pathway(s)

param.name: pids
param.label: Copy/paste your pathway id(s)
param.help: IDs must be separated by "," into the form field, for example: "00010,05412" or "hsa00010,05412"

tool.help:
This tool map a list of Uniprot Accession number or Entrez gene ID to KEGG pathway with pathview R package.
Select an input file containing ids in a column, set header and column number or copy/paste your ids.
Select your identifier type and a species of interest (for now only human available).
Select one or several pathways of interest from the dropdown menu or copy/paste KEGG pathway id(s)
Select the graph format : KEGG or graphviz
Uniprot accession number converted to Entrez geneID or Entrez geneID are mapped to each selected pathways.
Output : One file (png or pdf) for each selected pathway.
